item.title: A cluster of 14 potholes between 50 - 60 Longland Drive, 7th February
item.description:
These potholes have been there from a botched road repair done over a year ago. It keeps getting from bad to worse and is becoming dangerous due to people tripping and cars swerving to avoid.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Longland Drive, Woodside Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken temp lights, 7th February
item.description:
Lights not working Causing massive issues on Albany street Conservation area Noise Car traffic Aggressive drivers

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Fitzrovia, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rolled up discarded mattress, 7th February
item.description:
This mattress has been there for over 2 weeks now and people are using it as a rubbish bin. It is by the cemetery wall behind the red van that is permanently parked there so isn’t easily seen from the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Linden Grove, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple large potholes, 7th February
item.description:
The stretch of Waterloo Road from grays Road to the cut has numerous large deep pothole on both the north and south bound side of the road. Very dangerous for cyclists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterloo Road, Waterloo, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Narrow, 7th February
item.description:
For some reason, along sections of this road, construction sites have been allowed to put up hoardings which encroach onto the pavement. This makes the pavements very narrow, impossible for buggies or even two people to pass each other on foot. DO NOT REMOVE THE TREES! Please force the owners of those sites to remain within the land they own and do not give consents for them to expand into public space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Drummond Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
On westbound Fairlawn Avenue stop on Fortis Green N2
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fortis Green, Muswell Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrical and fire issue - illegal wiring, 7th February
item.description:
Wiring from a flat 41 possibly 3rd floor of block 45 provost street N1 7NW Illegal running of electrical wires across buildings- this is urgent we’ve already had a fire where someone died. Buildings control and planning issue

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Provost Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There used to be a road here, 7th February
item.description:
The road has all but disappeared now. It is just holes. It is extremely dangerous to ride across the junction now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): East Dulwich Road, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes dumped here repeatedly, 7th February
item.description:
Bike number on attached photo. Lime bikes are illegally dumped in this narrow passageway, causing maximum impact on blind and visually impaired pedestrians and other disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Birkbeck Road, Shacklewell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vandalised motor cycle, 7th February
item.description:
A motorcycle scooter has been abandoned on grass (public land),it is broken, has no registration, is vandalised and causing a nuisance. Please remove pursuant to the councils duty under the Refuse Disposal (Amenity) Act 1978.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Prince Henry Road, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The entire road surface is more hole than road, 7th February
item.description:
The road surface has got to the point where it is very dangerous to ride across the junction. There is very little of the actual road surface left. When it rains more and more of the road gets washed away.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham Rye, East Dulwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally dumped on footway causing maximum impact on blind pedestrians, 7th February
item.description:
The numbers are in the attached photos. Lime bikes are frequently dumped here, causing maximum impact on blind and visually impaired pedestrians and other disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Sandringham Road, Shacklewell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Park sports equipment broken completely, 7th February
item.description:
Please replace the open air park ,,sports equipment,, in the central venue park on Kelly Avenue. Unfortunately it's completely destroyed by some aggressive vandalism. Could be great to install CCTV cameras near the park sports equipment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Commercial Way, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in the middle of the pedestrian crossing at the junction of Hurst Road and Dorchester Avenue., 7th February
item.description:
Pothole in the road on the pedestrian crossing situated at the junction of Hurst Road and Dorchester Avenue. Likely to cause injury if anyone catches their foot in the pothole.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penfold Lane, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
